Comment: I like to describe myself as fiscally conservative: we need to make sure our fiscal spending comes with fiscal responsibility. What we spend money on should provide value, and the spending should have strong guardrails against fraud and abuse.   Republicans may say the same thing, but they dismantle consumer watchdogs, fire inspectors general, allow organizations to exist without a quorum of leadership, deny FOIA requests, and bypass bidding processes to self deal contracts. They use language to gaslight and project a reality that does not exist.  The truth is they are bad at math, bad at business, and bad at budgeting. I‚Äôve heard a Trump voter claim everything happening now is justified because the national debt is such an emergency. This ignores the fact that the 2017 tax cuts predicted an increase in the deficit and that played out. It ignores the fact that the debt increases over Trump‚Äôs four year term outweighed the debt increase in Obama‚Äôs eight years. It ignores the fact that Trump spent $151m in four years golfing at his own resorts when Obama spent $91m over eight years at resorts without self dealing compensation. None of these facts suggest that Trump or Republicans are good for the national debt.
Author: MultiGeometry
